name: Frontend Test Plan
title: Frontend Test Plan
description: Tailored to your health goals and preferences

meals.description: Creamy ricotta with berries and nuts, prepared the night before
instructions: Mix ricotta with vanilla extract and honey in a bowl
Layer half the ricotta mixture in a jar or container
Add half the berries and sprinkle chia seeds
Add remaining ricotta and top with remaining berries
Sprinkle chopped walnuts on top
Refrigerate overnight and enjoy in the morning
meals.goal_alignment: High protein for satiety and muscle preservation during weight loss, prepared ahead for convenience

meals.description: Fresh mozzarella, tomatoes, and basil with protein-rich quinoa
instructions: Cook quinoa according to package instructions and let cool
Cut mozzarella into bite-sized pieces
Halve cherry tomatoes
Tear basil leaves into smaller pieces
Whisk balsamic vinegar and olive oil together
Combine quinoa, mozzarella, tomatoes, and spinach in a bowl
Drizzle with dressing and toss gently
Top with fresh basil before serving
meals.goal_alignment: Balanced macros with high-quality protein and fiber for sustained fullness and energy

meals.food_name: One-Pot Lentil Bolognese with Zucchini Noodles
meals.description: Hearty lentil sauce served over spiralized zucchini for a low-carb Italian dinner
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat
Dice onion and mince garlic, sauté until fragrant
Add red lentils, crushed tomatoes, and vegetable broth
Season with oregano, salt, and pepper
Simmer for 20 minutes until lentils are tender
Meanwhile, spiralize zucchini into noodles
In the last 3 minutes, add zucchini noodles to the pot
Stir gently and cook until zucchini is just tender
Serve immediately topped with grated parmesan
meals.goal_alignment: High fiber and protein for maximum satiety with lower calories, one-pot preparation minimizes cleanup

days.day_notes: Focus on Italian flavors with high-protein, high-fiber meals for optimal satiety

meals.description: Vanilla chia pudding with Greek yogurt and almonds, prepared the night before
instructions: Mix chia seeds with almond milk in a jar
Add protein powder and whisk until smooth
Let sit for 5 minutes, then whisk again to prevent clumping
Refrigerate overnight
In the morning, stir in Greek yogurt
Top with sliced strawberries and almonds
Serve immediately
meals.goal_alignment: Ultra-high protein breakfast for muscle preservation and all-day satiety, prepared ahead for convenience

meals.food_name: Italian White Bean and Arugula Salad
meals.description: Protein-packed cannellini beans with peppery arugula and sun-dried tomatoes
instructions: Drain and rinse cannellini beans
Thinly slice red onion and soak in cold water for 10 minutes
Chop sun-dried tomatoes into strips
Whisk lemon juice and olive oil together
Combine beans, drained onion, and sun-dried tomatoes
Add arugula and toss with dressing
Top with torn mozzarella and pine nuts
Let flavors meld for 5 minutes before serving
meals.goal_alignment: High fiber and protein combination promotes sustained fullness and stable blood sugar

meals.description: Hearty vegetarian stew with white beans, vegetables, and Italian herbs
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat
Dice onion, carrots, and celery; mince garlic
Sauté vegetables until softened, about 8 minutes
Add garlic and rosemary, cook for 1 minute
Add diced tomatoes, beans, and vegetable broth
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer 20 minutes
Stir in spinach and cook until wilted
Season with salt and pepper to taste
Serve hot topped with grated parmesan
meals.goal_alignment: Maximum fiber and protein for exceptional satiety, one-pot preparation for easy cleanup

days.day_notes: Bean-focused day for maximum fiber and plant protein to support weight loss goals

variety_score: Excellent variety with different protein sources (ricotta, mozzarella, lentils, beans, Greek yogurt), cooking methods (no-cook, assembly, one-pot), and Italian-Mediterranean flavors throughout both days
goal_alignment: This plan supports weight loss through high-protein, high-fiber meals that promote satiety while staying within calorie targets. Quick breakfast prep and one-pot dinners meet convenience requirements while maintaining nutritional quality.
shopping_tips: Buy canned beans and lentils in bulk for protein. Prep vegetables on Sunday for the week. Greek yogurt and ricotta provide versatile protein bases. Fresh herbs can be frozen in ice cube trays with olive oil for longer storage.
